title: Firefly signs multi-launch agreement with L3Harris
summary: Firefly Aerospace has won a contract from L3Harris for as many as 20 launches of its Alpha rocket over five years.

title: In the West, ties between space and defense are strengthening
summary: The RAND research group, whose aim is to look for ways to fix public policy issues in the United States and make communities safer, healthier and richer, published on June […]

title: Oxford Space Systems shares Yagi antenna deployment
summary: LOGAN, Utah — Oxford Space Systems announced the successful deployment Aug. 7 of its Yagi very high frequency, high gain antenna. The U.K. company released images showing Yagi deploy on […]

title: Take a trip to Mars’s largest lake
summary: Mars once hosted a lake larger than any on Earth. The broken-down and dried-up remnants of this ancient lakebed are shown here in amazing detail by ESA’s Mars Express.

title: NASA delays Crew-9 launch as it grapples with Starliner problems
summary: NASA is postponing the launch of the next crew rotation mission to the International Space Station by a month as examines when, or if, Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner spacecraft can complete its test flight.

title: Airbus Taps Lufthansa to Provide Starlab Astronaut Training
summary: Airbus Defence and Space and Lufthansa Aviation Training have agreed to cooperate in the development of an effective training process for the crews of the future Starlab commercial space station. US-based Voyager Space and Airbus signed an agreement in August 2023 to jointly pursue the development of the Starlab space station. The pair is currently […]

title: From Star City to Cape Canaveral, how a cosmonaut trains for a SpaceX flight
summary: Although US astronauts are able to launch from Florida, some American astronauts still launch aboard Soyuz. Tracy Caldwell Dyson, an American, is aboard the ISS as of this writing, arriving after a liftoff from Kazakhstan on Soyuz MS-25. NASA and Roscosmos recently reached an agreement for a ride share, allowing one open seat for astronauts on Soyuz, and in turn one seat on American commercial crew vehicles for cosmonauts.

title: Crew-9 Launch Slips to Give NASA More Time to Analyze Starliner Data
summary: NASA is delaying the launch of the next International Space Station crew exchange mission, Crew-9, as it continues to assess the health of Boeing’s Starliner capsule. Framing the decision as […]

title: Dcubed raises 4.4 million euros for in-space manufacturing

title: NASA & SpaceX Delay Crew 9 To September 24 Due To Starliner Mission Delays
summary: NASA & SpaceX Delay Crew 9 To September 24 Due To Starliner Mission Delays
